SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
ENHANCE YOUR CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE WITH SALESFORCE FEEDBACK MANAGEMENT
Set Up Engagement Channel

To analyze a survey based on engagement channels, set up the engagement context for the survey. First, create a custom metadata type, add a custom field called Engagement Channel, and then select the new custom metadata type as the survey’s engagement context.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available for an extra charge in Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions where Salesforce Surveys is enabled.


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create a custom metadata type:	Customize Application
To change a survey’s default settings:	Profile that allows the user to create and send surveys
Create a custom metadata type called Engagement Key.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Custom Metadata Types, and then click Custom Metadata Types.
Click New Custom Metadata Type.
For Label, enter Engagement Key.
For Plural Label, enter Engagement Keys.
Save your changes.
Add a custom field called Engagement Channel.
In the Custom Fields section of the Engagement Key page, click New.
Select Picklist, then click Next.
For Field Label, enter Engagement Channel.
In the text box, enter the names of channels that your business supports. Enter each value in a new line.
NOTE If you want to use channel names dynamically from another object, leave the text box empty
Click Next.
Save your changes.
In the survey’s default settings, select Engagement Key as the engagement context custom metadata type.
Open the latest version of the survey you want to configure.
Click .
Select Default Settings.
From the Content picklist, select the survey question.
From the Email Templates picklist, select the email template.
From the Engagement Context Custom Metadata Type picklist, select Engagement Channel.
Save your changes and activate the survey.
Set up the Survey Invitation Engagement Context.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Customer Lifecycle Maps, and then click Customer Lifecycle Maps.
Go to the customer lifecycle map that contains the stage you want to associate the engagement context with.
Select the stage and click Add Question.
Select the survey and the question for the stage.
Click , and then select Invitation Rules.
NOTE If Invitation Rules is disabled, refresh the page and try again.
In the Configure a survey trigger window, define the required settings that determine when the survey is sent.
Add the survey invitation engagement context.
For Context Type, select Engagement Channel.
For Data Type, select Picklist to use a static value. Or select Lookup to use values from another object.
For Context Value, select a channel.
Save and activate the trigger.

title: Setting Up Engagement Channel for Salesforce Feedback Management
